text_jumbo_copy_copy.text: Use this page as a resource to our most frequently asked questions. Solve your problem quickly!
text_jumbo_copy_copy.title:
Digital Asset Upload Portal
Frequently Asked Questions

text_jumbo_copy_copy_231447491.text:
What is the difference between Single Asset Upload and Multi Asset Upload?

Single Asset Upload should be used when you are uploading one asset.

Multi Asset Upload should be used when you are uploading multiple assets that has unique metadata. Use the excel template to define the metadata for each individual assets being uploaded and review the overview tab on the excel template for step by step instructions.

 

Is there a specific naming convention I need to use for my images?

Bed Bath & Beyond does not enforce any naming convention rules however you must include the “.jpg”  extension on file names when filling out the metadata spreadsheet during Multi Asset Upload.

 

What is the maximum number of images that can be uploaded at one time?

The maximum batch is 400 assets and may take 2-5 minutes to process.

Processing’s speeds are network, browser & machine dependent.

  • A good internet connection will avoid connection issues, and ensure timely uploads
  • Preferred browsers include Google Chrome & IE10+
  • PC should be have a minimum of 4GB of memory (RAM) 

 

How can I remove all the assets I uploaded?

Click on the “Cancel” button on the bottom of the screen to remove the assets. If you do click “Cancel”, it will remove all the assets in the batch.

 

Can I upload mulitple batches at one time?

You will need to go back to the Home page to initiate a second upload after the first upload is submitted and confirmed.

 

Why am I receiving an error message when I attempt to upload my metadata spreadsheet?
  1. Ensure that there are no spaces in the excel filename.
  2. Ensure you are always using the latest version of the metadata template 

 

When do I need to include the "Shot Type" information in the metadata?

If you select “Product Image” for your image you must choose a Shot Type.

 

Does DAM go to sleep if left inactive?

DAM is a cloud-based system and does not go to sleep.

 

Please advise if DAM logs me out if left inactive?

Your session may expire if left inactive and Partners Portal may require you to log in again.

 

Does DAM auto-save?

DAM does not auto-save.

 

Where can I see what I have previously uploaded?

Navigate to the history tab in the top right corner of the portal.

Note: History is captured by user profile, not company profile 

 

For technical difficulties, please reach out to BBBYQCPhoto@bedbath.com.
